organization.description:
A collection of data about country level energy demand and energy generation technologies to the meet the demand with details of:

- land area required for different energy generation sources
- monetary cost of energy source to develop, implement, maintain and decommission, either by government or industry
- location or suitable location
- energy cost to make and maintain and decommission
- time to develop
- efficiency in cost/unit of energy 
- how efficiency is predicted to change over time
organization.title: Energy Data
organization.name: energy-data

name: energy-markal-economic-model-electricity-supply
notes:
# The MARKAL Data Model #

The MARKet Allocation (MARKAL) data model is designed for the purpose of choosing future electricity sources. 

For example the UK model contains the energy sources:

- Combined Heat and Power
- Renewables
- Nuclear
- Gas-fired Power
- Coal

and there are extra considerations for CO2 pipeline and storage. 

For each of the energy source the UK MARKAL model has values for:

- First year available 	
- Construction period (years)	
- Efficiency (%)	
- Availability (%)	
- Capital cost (£/kW)
- O&M (fixed)  (£/kW)
- O&M (variable)  (£/GJ)
- O&M 	
- Life (years)

Some energy sources have extra information specific to them.   

The model does *not* contain details for:

- availability of locations for the power plants
- availability of resources for construction
- costs of construction
- other forms of energy other than electricity

## 2007 MARKAL Input for DECC ##
More details about the 2007 MARKAL input parameters for the Department of Energy and Climate Change are available at:

http://data.ukedc.rl.ac.uk/cgi-bin/dataset_catalogue//view.cgi.py?id=4

It includes an explanation of why there are two sheets for every energy source, that is: 

- In the first worksheet the data is included in the form in which it is presented in the original sources. 
- In the second worksheet (marked A - for Adjusted) the units and currencies are converted to those of the MARKAL model. 

Notes have been inserted to indicate the currency or unit of measurement. 

The numbers which have been subject to adjustment have been highlighted in yellow. 

A separate sheet showing the conversion factors used has been included ('Conversion').  

## MARKAL Schema ##
Following a Freedom of Information request for the MARKAL schema (http://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/request_the_schema_of_the_markal#incoming-66314) it would seem the documentation for the schema is at:

http://www.ukerc.ac.uk/support/ESMMARKALDocs08 

## Other useful information about MARKAL ##

- http://www.ukerc.ac.uk/support/tiki-download_file.php?fileId=205&highlight=MARKAL
title: Ecomonic Model of Future Electricity Supply (MARKAL)
